intro: Torminalis clusii, commonly known as the Clusiaceae or the genus of the genus Clusia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its thick, succulent leaves and showy, often brightly colored flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. The leaves are usually alternate and can be either simple or lobed, depending on the species.
